legal.question: Is it legal to download YouTube subtitles?
legal.answer: Yes, downloading subtitles for personal use, research, accessibility, or educational purposes is generally legal. However, always respect copyright laws and YouTube's terms of service.

formats.question: What subtitle formats do you support?
formats.answer: We support SRT (SubRip), VTT (WebVTT), and clean TXT formats. SRT is perfect for video editing, VTT for web players, and TXT for AI training and text analysis.

bulk.question: Can I download subtitles from entire YouTube playlists?
bulk.answer: Yes! Our bulk YouTube subtitle downloader can extract captions from entire playlists and channels. This is perfect for creating large datasets for AI training or research projects.

languages.question: Does this work with different languages?
languages.answer: Absolutely! Our tool can download subtitles in any language available on the YouTube video, including auto-generated captions and manually uploaded subtitles.

limits.question: Are there any download limits?
limits.answer: Free users get 5 daily credits for subtitle downloads. Pro members enjoy unlimited bulk downloads for large-scale projects and commercial use.

items.q: How do I download an entire YouTube playlist with subtitles?
items.a: To download a {strong1} in bulk, simply copy the playlist URL from your browser and paste it into YTVidHub's {strong2}. Our advanced engine will crawl the entire playlist, extract the captions for each video, and bundle them into an organized ZIP file for you.

items.q: Can I extract subtitles from multiple YouTube videos at once?
items.a: Yes! You can paste a list of multiple individual video URLs or a channel link. YTVidHub is the leading {strong1} and {strong2}, allowing for unlimited URLs for Pro members.

items.q: What file formats do you support for captions?
items.a: We support the three most common formats: {strong1}, {strong2}, and {strong3}. You can toggle between these formats before starting your bulk download.

items.q: Does this tool support auto-generated YouTube subtitles?
items.a: Absolutely. Our {strong} can extract both manually uploaded subtitles and YouTube's auto-generated closed captions (CC) in any available language. The tool works with all types of YouTube captions.

items.q: Is there a limit to how many subtitles I can download?
items.a: Free users have a daily quota for {strong1}. {strong2} enjoy unlimited bulk extraction, allowing them to download subtitles for thousands of videos in a single operation using our advanced {strong3}.
